Today's Subcommittee on Communications & Technology hearing will discuss the obstacles which women and people of color face in media ownership. Underrepresentation does a real disservice to Americans who rely on radio and TV for entertainment and news - and we must address it.

Women make up 51% of the U.S. population
People of color make up 40% of the U.S. population
Yet they own only 10% of TV and radio. üëÄ
 
Media outlets owned by women and people of color are more likely to offer diverse programming - which represents the diversity of this country.
